Arrangement.text:
Chorus: [G] We sing Your [D]merc[Em]ies, We sing Your [C]endless praises [G] We sing Your [D]ever[C]lasting love [D] [G] We sing Your [D]merc[Em]ies, We sing Your [C]endless praises [G] Sov’reign [D]One who [Em]died [C] [G] Sov’reign [D]One who [C]died [D] for [G D | C | G D | C |]us
Verse 1: [Em] Should He who [D/F#]made the [G]stars{,} be [Am7]hung upon a [C2]tree [Em] And should the [D/F#]hands that [G]healed{,} be [Am7]driven through for [Dsus D]me Should [Em7]He who gave us [D/F#]bread, be [C2]made to swallow [Em7]gall Should [C]He who gave us [Bm]breath and [Em]life Be [F]slaughtered for us [Dsus D (to chorus)]all?
Verse 2: [Em] Should He who [D/F#]is the [G]light,{,} be [Am7]cast into the [C2]dark [Em] And should the [D/F#]Lord of [G]love, be [Am7]pierced through His own [Dsus D]heart Should [Em7]He who called us [D/F#]friends{,} be des[C2]erted by us [Em7]all Should [C]He who lived a [Bm]sinless [Em]life Be [F]punished for our [Dsus D (to chorus)]fall?
Bridge: Should [F2]He who is the [C/E]light,{,} be [Cm/Eb]cast into the [G/D]dark And [F2]should the Lord of [C/E]love, be [Cm/Eb]pierced through His own [F2]heart Be [Cm/Eb]pierced through His own [F2 (to chorus)]heart
